com.beaglebuddy.id3.pojo.v24

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.id3.pojo.v24.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    A Level is a point on an EQ curve. It contains the following fields.

    Level Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. frequencythe frequency (in hz) at which the point on EQ curve is located. Allowed values are from [0 hz - 32767 hz]. ex: 500 hz
    2. volume the amount to increase/decrease the volume in db. Allowed values are from [-64 db - +64 db]. ex: -2.5 db

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Level()
      The default constructor is called when creating a flat level.
      Level(short frequency, double volume)
      constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      short getFrequency()
      get the frequency (in hz) at which the equalization level occurs.
      double getVolume()
      get the volume adjustment (in db) for this frequency.
      void setFrequency(short frequency)
      set the frequency (in hz) at which the equalization level occurs.
      void setVolume(double volume)
      set the amount of volume adjustment (in db) for this frequency.
      Ex: +2.5 db
      Ex: -3.0 db
      java.lang.String toString()
      get a string representation of an ID3v2.4 equalization level.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level()
        The default constructor is called when creating a flat level. The default values used are:
        • 0 hz
        • 0 db

     double volume)
        constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getFrequency

        public short getFrequency()
        get the frequency (in hz) at which the equalization level occurs.
        Returns:
        the frequency (in hz) at which this equalization level occurs.

      • setFrequency

        public void setFrequency(short frequency)
        set the frequency (in hz) at which the equalization level occurs.
        Parameters:
        frequency - the frequency (in hz) at which the equalization level occurs. Allowed values are from 0 hz - 32767 hz.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified frequency is less than 0 hz or greater than to 32767 hz.

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        get the volume adjustment (in db) for this frequency.
        Returns:
        the amount of volume adjustment (in db) for this equalization level.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double volume)
        set the amount of volume adjustment (in db) for this frequency.
        Ex: +2.5 db
        Ex: -3.0 db
        Parameters:
        volume - the amount of volume (in db) to adjust this equalization level. Allowed values are from -64 db - +64 db.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the volume is not in the range of ±64 db.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        get a string representation of an ID3v2.4 equalization level.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of an ID3v2.4 equalization level.
